summary:
A self-motivated and innovative individual with an excellent track record of initiating and managing research on materials development and device prototyping. I specialize in the field of Energy Conversion and Storage, Water electrolysis, 3d porous electrodes, Organic/inorganic nanocomposite and Intermetallic Materials, Microstructural and Electrochemical characteristics, optimization, and structure-property correlations. 
My current research is focused on designing and fabricating nano-/micro-architectured 3d porous electrodes for highly efficient large-scale water electrolysis. I have expertise in various materials development and testing using a range of techniques such as sol-gel, electrochemical deposition, ball-milling/mechanical alloying, powder processing, nanocomposite, hot-compaction, and sintering. 
I have hands-on experience with X-ray diffraction, electron microscopy (SEM, TEM, EBSD, EDS, SAED, CBED), magnetometry (VSM, SQUID, PPMS), calorimetry (DSC, TGA), and electrochemical (EIS, voltammetry) characterization techniques.
I have led and managed scientific projects, established international collaborations, and taught and trained bachelor's and master's degree students. My scientific accomplishments are evident in 12 publications as the first author and a contribution of over 20 abstracts in international conferences.

profile_positions.description:
Hybrid solid-electrolytes and porous 3d electrodes for Electrolyzers
- Developing novel proton-conducting materials with hybrid metal-organic coordinating polymers and organic-inorganic nanocomposites for high-efficiency electrolyzers. Synthesizing flexible solid-electrolyte membrane, and fabricating and optimizing membrane electrode assembly process.
- Designing and fabricating non-novel metal 3d electrodes using 3D printing, solvent phase separation, electrochenical and electrophoretic deposition techniques and creating mesoporous and microporous structures for high current density electrolysis.
- Tuning structural, electrochemical, and mechanical properties of solid-electrolytes and electrode materials. Analyzing the materials by XRD, XAFS, SEM, TEM, FTIR, NMR, and EIS techniques and testing cell performance.
- Supervising, training, and helping Master's and Ph.D. students in the lab.
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Solid Electrolytes and nanocomposite Cathodes for Solid-state Na-ion Batteries
- Designed and developed high ion-conducting NASICON-type solid-electrolyte and cathode materials by crystal engineering and microstructure refinement for high performance Na-ion batteries.
- Achieved a multifold increase in the ionic conductivity by Sc-Yb, Ce and Si doping in Na3Zr2P3O12 reaching to 2.5 mS/cm well suitable for solid-state Na-ion batteries. 
- Synthesized nanostructured cathode materials, prepared nanocomposite cathode coating, and fabricated coin cells with superior specific capacity (115 mAh/g) and excellent performance at high current rate (10C). 
- Improved the overall cell performance regarding energy density and cycleability by  20 %. 
- Managed the research lab and co-supervised and trained masters and PhD students.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Intermetallic Compounds for Energy Efficient Magnetic Cooling
- Developed the project approach, and initiated the research on Magnetocalorics and Magnetic Cooling.
- Established a magnetostructural coupling in Mn-Co-Ge by tuning the magnetic and structural degrees of freedom through crystallographic distortion and manipulating the magnetic spin states.
-  Acheived a 15 fold enhancement in the magnetocaloric effect and reported the highest value of entropy change (~60 J/kg.K) in Mn-Co-Ge.
profile_positions.title: Post-doctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Development of Rare-Earth-Free Permanent Magnets
- Improved magnetization and magnetocrystalline anisotropy of (Fe-Co)3B compounds through microstructure- and crystal-engineering.
- Established high-temperature processing routes of arc- and induction-melting followed by long-term homogenization to synthesize (Co-Fe)3B intermetallic compounds. 
- For the first time, succeeded to stabilize the metastable high-magnetic-moment τ-Fe3B phase in bulk amount at room temperature via minute substitution of Fe by Mo.
- Coordinated and executed various tasks of the project.
- Taught Materials Technology course and trained graduate students in the lab.

profile_positions.description:
Anisotropic hard magnetic nanostructures through surfactant-assisted ball milling
- Deveoped a novel surfactant-assisted ball milling method for the synthesis of highly reactive SmCo5 and Nd2Fe14B nanoparticles and nanoflakes. 
- Optimized different processing parameters to obtain the nanostructures with desired microstructural and magnetic properties. 
- Devised a fabrication method of single-crystalline Nd2Fe14B nanoparticles in a large amount (tens-of-grams). 
- Synthesized nanocomposite magnets by hot-compaction of a homogeneous mixture of ultrafine hard magnetic particles and Fe nanoparticles and investigated the microstructural and magnetic properties.
